current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of
		  1965 by establishing a program to provide professional development activities
		  for educators, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Health, Education, Labor,
			 and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Professional Development for
			 Educators Act of 2013

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: finds the following:

text.#text:
Through careful
			 development, teachers can build their effectiveness over time, thus improving
			 student achievement.

Ongoing
			 professional development of teachers in the subjects they teach is essential
			 for improved student learning.

United States
			 teachers generally spend more time instructing students and less time in
			 professional learning opportunities with their peers than teachers in
			 top-performing countries.

It takes time,
			 resources, and support for teachers to become highly effective in their
			 classrooms. Teachers participating in quality teacher professional development
			 must be given time to implement what they have learned.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:2503/ss:a/p:1

text.#text:
A State that
				receives an allotment under this part shall use funds described in

Develop, in
				collaboration with the local educational agencies in the State and with the
				input of teachers and principals employed by the local educational agencies, a
				definition of, and the criteria for, quality professional development
				activities, which shall include a requirement that such activities are
				regularly evaluated for their impact on increasing teacher effectiveness and
				improving student achievement.

Design and
				implement methods for evaluating quality professional development activities
				occurring in the State.

Make
				recommendations, to the State educational agency and to local educational
				agencies, to improve quality professional development activities in the
				State.

Design and
				maintain a registry that is an electronic and searchable method of storing
				information regarding quality professional development activities. The registry
				shall be searchable by relevant criteria, including—

subject
				matter;

grade
				level;
location;

credits,
				credentials, or certificates that may be earned; and

entity providing
				the activity.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, and carry out other
				activities to further the purposes of this part.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:2503/ss:b/p:4

text.#text:
Hire regional
				professional development coordinators to work as liaisons between the State and
				local educational agencies to assess existing professional development
				activities, assist in creating new quality professional development activities,
				provide to the State the quality professional development activities to be
				included in the registry described in

Evaluate the
				professional development activities available in the State.

, an annual report regarding the progress made under the

				funds.
